AVAILABLE_CONTACTS_VIEW_HTTP500_20260107.task: Fix HTTP 500 error handling in AvailableContactsView.get() method

changes: Added exc_info=True to logger.error() for full traceback logging
Updated log message prefix to [AvailableContactsView.get()] for clarity
Added 'detail' field to error response with actual exception message
Improved error response structure with clear 'error' and 'detail' fields

improvements: Full exception traceback now logged for debugging (exc_info=True)
Client receives actual error details in response (str(e))
Better error identification with prefixed log messages
Response structure matches API conventions (error, detail, success)

LOGIN_AUTH_ORDER_FIX_20260107.task: Fix authentication logic order in login_view() - check is_active before password validation

changes: Refactored authentication logic into 4 steps
Step 1 (lines 122-135): Get user by email or username (direct DB query)
Step 2 (lines 149-159): Check is_active BEFORE password validation
Step 3 (lines 161-171): Validate password using check_password()
Step 4 (lines 173-226): Create token and return success

old_flow: 3. If success and is_active -> create token
4. If success but NOT is_active -> return 403
new_flow: 1. Get user by email/username from DB

error_codes.401_unauthorized: Invalid credentials (user not found or password wrong)

security_improvements: is_active check happens before password validation - prevents unnecessary crypto operations
Direct DB queries instead of Django authenticate() for clearer control flow
Proper error differentiation: 401 vs 403 for different failure reasons
Logging distinguishes between inactive users and invalid credentials

MESSAGE_DELETE_PERMISSION_20260107.task: Fix message deletion permissions - implement OR logic for author/admin delete

1_new_permission_class.description: Allows delete if: (1) user is message author, OR (2) user is admin/staff/superuser
1_new_permission_class.prevents: Django REST Framework AND logic which required ALL permissions to pass

2_viewset_permission.reason: CanDeleteMessage combines author/admin check with OR logic

fixes: Admin bypass now grants access to ALL chat types (not just FORUM chats)
Teacher access to CLASS chats now works (was failing for non-FORUM types)
Added fallback to M2M participants check for non-FORUM room types

lines_modified.admin_bypass: Line 908-911: Removed room.type restriction for admin
lines_modified.teacher_forum_logic: Line 917-937: Added M2M check after FORUM-specific logic
lines_modified.scope: Fixes WebSocket connection failures for Teacher/Admin to CLASS chats

security_properties: Only author or admin can delete messages
Teachers cannot delete other users' messages
Teachers can still moderate via pin/unpin/lock/unlock actions
Admin has full access to all chat types

FORUM_PARENT_ACCESS_FIX_20260107.task: Fix Chat Forums parent access logika - T054 task
FORUM_PARENT_ACCESS_FIX_20260107.issue_description: Parents could not get read access to forum chats of their children

failure_details.error_message: Object of type datetime is not JSON serializable
failure_details.root_cause: AssignmentHistory.objects.create() tries to serialize datetime in changes_dict to JSON
failure_details.impact: When editing assignment deadline, history record creation fails
failure_details.notes: This is a signal-level issue, not a basic CRUD issue. Datetime fields need custom JSON encoder.

summary.status_summary: 3/3 Tasks substantially completed - Task 2 has 1 serialization issue in history signals

lines_modified.forum_subject: Added verify block (lines 134-150) for parent in FORUM_SUBJECT
lines_modified.forum_tutor: Added verify block (lines 232-248) for parent in FORUM_TUTOR

details: Checks if parent exists in participants after M2M.add()
Logs DEBUG on success: 'Added parent {username} to forum'
Logs WARNING on failure: 'Parent failed to be added'

2_materials_signals_enhancement.action: Enhanced create_subject_forum_chat to add parent as participant
changes: Now imports ChatParticipant and StudentProfile

Creates ChatParticipant records with bulk_create
Added parent verification logic (lines 499-514)

2_materials_signals_enhancement.new_behavior: Signal now adds student, teacher, AND parent automatically

logic: Checks if any child is in room.participants
Adds parent to room.participants if add_to_participants=True

4_forum_views_integration.status: Already correctly integrated - no changes needed
calls: Line 398: messages() action calls check_parent_access_to_room(user, chat)
Line 564: send_message() action calls check_parent_access_to_room(user, chat)

changes: child_forum fixture: Changed from ChatRoom.objects.create() to ChatRoom.objects.get()
other_forum fixture: Changed from ChatRoom.objects.create() to ChatRoom.objects.get()

at_enrollment_creation: Forum created with 3 participants: student + teacher + parent
when_parent_accesses_forum: Checks: (1) parent in participants M2M, (2) parent in ChatParticipant table
If not found: calls check_parent_access_to_room(parent_user, room)
check_parent_access_to_room validates parent via StudentProfile relationship

parent_write_restriction: Parent can be participant (added by signal)
But API layer prevents parent from sending messages
forum_views.send_message() uses is_staff check to block parent writes

LOGIN_IMPORTS_REORGANIZATION_20260107.task: Fix PEP8 import organization in login_view - move imports from function to top of file

ASSIGNMENT_HISTORY_DATETIME_SERIALIZATIO.task: Fix datetime JSON serialization issue in AssignmentHistory signals
ASSIGNMENT_HISTORY_DATETIME_SERIALIZATIO.problem_description: Django JSONField cannot serialize datetime objects directly. When editing assignment deadlines, history record creation failed with: TypeError: Object of type datetime is not JSON serializable

solution.implementation: Added serialize_changes() utility function to recursively convert non-JSON-serializable objects to strings
details: - Converts datetime objects to ISO format strings using .isoformat()

new_function.name: serialize_changes()
new_function.purpose: Recursively convert datetime and other non-JSON-serializable objects to strings

test_results.previous_status: FAILED (TypeError: Object of type datetime is not JSON serializable)

datetime_handling.backward_compatibility: Existing records unaffected; only new history records use serialized format

ASSIGNMENT_N_PLUS_1_QUERIES_FIX_20260107.task: Fix N+1 queries issue in assignments ViewSets - optimize get_queryset() methods
ASSIGNMENT_N_PLUS_1_QUERIES_FIX_20260107.problem_description: Multiple ViewSet get_queryset() methods were missing select_related() and prefetch_related() calls, causing N+1 query issues when accessing ForeignKey and ManyToMany relationships

solution.implementation: Added select_related() and prefetch_related() calls to all ViewSet get_queryset() methods

optimization_impact.queries_reduction: N+1 eliminated for each ViewSet by eagerly loading related objects
optimization_impact.expected_improvement: 2-3x faster response times for list endpoints with related data
list_endpoints_affected: GET /api/assignments/ - Returns author data without N+1
GET /api/submissions/ - Returns student + assignment data efficiently
GET /api/answers/ - Returns submission + question references efficiently
GET /api/peer-assignments/ - Returns complex nested data efficiently
GET /api/peer-reviews/ - Returns nested assignment/student data efficiently
GET /api/attempts/ - Returns student + assignment + submission data efficiently

validation.black_formatting: PASSED - reformatted at 120 char line limit
